intro: Hebeclinium cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' hebeclinium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
